M: Hello, everyone. I am the manager of this school. Sorry to interrupt your class. I just want to make a quick announcement about our summer timetable. Shimmers Dance School will be offering new classes this spring due to strong demand. First of all, your old friend Angela Stevenson will be back this term, running the pop dance class. This class will be on Tuesdays, and instead of the normal hour from 6:30 to 7:30, we’ll be running the class for an hour and a half, so it will continue until 8 o’clock. This means we have to charge higher fees, but only a little higher: ①from eight pounds fifty to ten pounds fifty. That’s only two pounds for the extra half hour. ②Next, Janine Davis will still be teaching the street dance classes. Instead of being on Mondays these classes will be on Wednesday nights from 7 o’clock to 8 o’clock. The fee will still be seven pounds fifty for the hour. M: Good evening, I’m Charles McKay, and this is the 9 o’clock evening news. The top news is for sports fans. It was an exciting day in world soccer. ①Mexico beat France 7 to 6, in a close game that offered us plenty of excitement. The game between Canada and Argentina ended in a tie, 3 to 3. And in a game that’s still in progress, Italy is leading England 2 to 1, with 30 minutes left to go.

The war against cigarette smoking is heating up again. ②A set of laws were introduced today that would make it illegal to advertise any tobacco product in any form of media. That means ads would be stopped from newspapers, magazines, televisions and radio. [{"id":6338,"main_id":51500,"questions":1,"subject":"Why does the woman make the phone call? ","answer":"B. To report problems. ","answer_a":"A. To ask for help. ","answer_b":"B. To report problems. ","answer_c":"C. To offer information.","answer_d":"","highlight":"","analysis":"

M: Good morning. Havenpool Borough Council. How may I help you?

W: Hello, my name is Jenny Smith and ①I’m just ringing to report a few  problems in my local area.

M: What problems are those?

W: Well, the first one is the shop next to my house. ②It’s been empty for about a year and it’s falling into disrepair. Quite a few of the windows are broken.

M: I see. Well, I’m afraid that’s not our responsibility here. It would be up to the owner.

W: I understand that, but I’ve called the owner several times and he refused to do anything about it.

M: Well, in that case,  you need to talk to the community officer. Her name is Hilary Sharpe. I can put you through to her if you like.

W: Wonderful. Before you put me through, there was another problem. It is to do with the sharp and big rocks above South Sands Beach. I watched some children playing there the other day and I think it’s really dangerous.It needs some sort of warning sign at least.

M: OK, I got that. I’ll deal with it right away. Thank you.

[{"id":6340,"main_id":51501,"questions":1,"subject":"Who is Patrick Millar? ","answer":"A. A well-known cook.","answer_a":"A. A well-known cook.","answer_b":"B. A director of the Palace Hotel.","answer_c":"C. A host of Food and Drink Show.","answer_d":"","highlight":"","analysis":"

W: Good morning and welcome to the Food and Drink Show. ①I’m Christine Whitelaw and I work as a Personal Assistant to the world-famous cook Patrick Millar. Are you wondering how I became a PA to such an important figure in the food and drink industry? Well, I always wanted to work in this industry, ②so after leaving school I completed a year on a cookery course before spending another year at a secretarial college. Then I worked as a PA to a director of the Palace Hotel in London for three years before hearing that Patrick Millar was advertising for a new PA. I applied, had two interviews and got the job.I usually meet Patrick first of all to run through his diary and letters. ③If customers are expected for lunch, I may take them on a pre-lunch tour of the cookery school. It has a collection of 6,000 cookery books. ③Then I take them to the restaurant. In the afternoons I usually do letters and make phone calls. If Patrick is busy in the mornings, we sometimes have a working lunch together in his office.

 I do enjoy cooking but I have no plans to work as a cook. ④The job I have combines everything I love: food, meeting people and being someone’s right hand.

W: We both start our new jobs next month, and we have to look for an apartment.

M: Hey, darling. I hadn’t realized it was so close already. What kind of place would you like?

W: Well, it’s too late to think about buying a house somewhere. We’ll have to rent an apartment first. ②It should be near the bus stop or subway.

M: What about the size?

W: Well, a two-bedroom place is OK.

M: It won’t be expensive. What kind of price do you think we can afford?

W: Oh, about six hundred dollars. It doesn’t have to be equipped with furniture. We have our own furniture. The apartment should not be in the city center. I like quietness.

M: Yeah, I agree.  I’d like the apartment to be near a park, so we can go running outdoors as usual.

W: Well, we can look for the information on the Internet or call Lily. She knows a lot about houses.

M:  I prefer the newspaper. We can take a look in the For Rent section.

W:  Good idea. Let’s hope we can find something good!

[{"id":6347,"main_id":51509,"questions":1,"subject":"What did the speaker do in Spain? ","answer":"A. She learned Spanish. ","answer_a":"A. She learned Spanish. ","answer_b":"B. She taught English. ","answer_c":"C. She visited her friends.","answer_d":"","highlight":"","analysis":"

W: Uh, about three years ago I went and lived in Madrid for a year and stayed with a host family, and there were three boys: one was my age, Jerry; one was two years younger, Jim and one was, at the time 9 years old, Javi. It was one of the best experiences of my life.

I stayed in a city outside of Madrid. It’s called Alcola de Hernades, and it’s about a 30-minute train ride from Madrid, from downtown Madrid. ①I also went to school from Monday to Friday. I went to a Spanish International language school, ②and so I went to class with Brazilians, the French, and Germans and so on. That was really good for my Spanish just because I was able to practice without having the ability to speak English, so my Spanish greatly improved, just from my friends, having to communicate properly with them. My host family as I said was really wonderful. ③I would take the little one, Javi, out a lot; we would go on what we called our citas, which is dates. With the help of Javi and his hostess Mum, I was able to thoroughly enjoy my experience in Spain and improve my Spanish as well.

M: Hello, everyone. I’m a big fan of films about the spy James Bond. I’ve got most of them on DVD. I’ve recently bought Quantum of Solace, in which Daniel Craig plays the part of Bond. It’s a great movie. All the actors who’ve played James Bond have been great, but Daniel Craig, who’s made lots of other films, plays the part better than any of the others. Even though he doesn’t talk very much, ①I think he’s the most perfect actor for the role. ② He even does a few of the more dangerous things in the film himself, instead of getting someone else to do them. I did wonder sometimes in the film whether he’d be clever enough to defeat the bad people — but I’m not going to tell you the ending! The actress who stars with Craig gives a fantastic performance too — I loved all the stylish clothes she wore! The director probably had a hard job making this film as full of action as the earlier ones. But the excitement starts right at the beginning here, with a car crash along a mountain road, and plenty of other thrilling scenes. ③Unfortunately I found the story difficult to follow sometimes, and it also seemed to be over very quickly — it lasted under two hours. I also felt there weren’t as many jokes as in the old Bond films. And where was all the ridiculous Bond equipment — the underwater car or exploding watch that everyone laughed at? This is a more serious, darker Bond film, but I still really enjoyed it.

It’s a great movie. All the actors who’ve played James Bond have been great, but Daniel Craig, who’s made lots of other films, plays the part better than any of the others. Even though he doesn’t talk very much, ①I think he’s the most perfect actor for the role. ② He even does a few of the more dangerous things in the film himself, instead of getting someone else to do them. I did wonder sometimes in the film whether he’d be clever enough to defeat the bad people — but I’m not going to tell you the ending! The actress who stars with Craig gives a fantastic performance too — I loved all the stylish clothes she wore! The director probably had a hard job making this film as full of action as the earlier ones. This is a more serious, darker Bond film, but I still really enjoyed it.

[{"id":6377,"main_id":51531,"questions":1,"subject":"What can people do in the “Gravity Chair”? ","answer":"A. Experience space walk. ","answer_a":"A. Experience space walk. ","answer_b":"B. Sleep in a special bed. ","answer_c":"C. See a rocket take off.","answer_d":"","highlight":"","analysis":"

M: Space Camp, Florida, which is right next to NASA’s famous Kennedy Space Center, is a place where people can go to learn

about space travel. Many activities are offered which provide visitors with the excitement of being in space. ①One of the many attractions is the “Gravity Chair”, which lets you see exactly how difficult walking in space really is! There is also a project which gives you the chance to build your own rocket and see it take off!

Camp programs are available for children and adults who want to experience an astronaut’s life. The “Space Habitat” is a place where you can eat freeze-dried food and sleep in a special bed, just like a real astronaut! ②Unfortunately though, children who are under nine years old are not allowed to take part in these programs which last five days. ③The cost for adults is $875 and the kids $550.There is a family ticket price of $1,500. It is a little expensive, but it is really worth it.
